transportAdvice: Okinawa's main island is best explored by rental car or scooter, as public buses cover major routes but can be infrequent and slow for reaching beach and rural attractions; a monorail serves central Naha city including the main shopping and cultural areas. Taxis are widely available and metered, making them a reliable option for shorter trips, though renting a vehicle is strongly recommended for independent exploration of the island.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with mild temperatures; the coolest month of the year but still warmer than mainland Japan.
Similar to January with cool, breezy conditions and occasional rain showers; not ideal for swimming.
Temperatures begin to rise and cherry blossoms may appear; still mild with some rainy spells.
Warm and pleasant with increasing sunshine; a good time to visit before the rainy season begins.
The rainy season begins in May, bringing frequent heavy showers and rising humidity.
Peak of the rainy season with persistent rain and high humidity; typhoon season also begins.
Hot and sunny as the rainy season ends; excellent beach weather but typhoons remain a risk.
Peak summer heat with strong sunshine and warm seas; the busiest tourist month but typhoon risk is highest.
Still warm and humid with the highest typhoon frequency; travel disruptions are possible.
Typhoon season winds down and conditions become more stable; warm and pleasant for outdoor activities.
Comfortable and mild with lower humidity; a quieter and enjoyable time to visit.
Cool and occasionally rainy as winter sets in; festive atmosphere in Naha but not ideal for beach activities.
